description.value:
Age. Lamenter reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, but then exist for about 150 years. Upon experation, they return into existance after a number of years in a new body.

Creature Type. You are Undead.

Size. You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you select this species.

Speed. Your walking speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

Deathless Nature. You are neither truly dead nor alive, a fact represented by the following benefits:

  • You have advantage on saving throws made against harmful gases and vapors (such as @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplCloudkill0]{Cloudkill} and @UUID[Compendium.materia-dnd.spells.Item.matSplStinkingCl]{Stinking Cloud} effects, inhaled Poisons, and the Breath Weapons of some dragons).
  • You have advantage on death saving throws.
  • You do not need to eat, drink, or breathe.
  • You do not need to sleep, and magic can not put you to sleep.

Imperishable Proficiency. You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice, and if you roll a 1 on the d20 when you make an ability check with these skills you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

Lament the Past. You temporarily remember glimpses of the past, perhaps faded memories from ages ago or a previous life. When you make an ability check that uses a tool or skill, you can roll a d4 immediately after seeing the number on the d20 and add the number on the d4 to the check. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Perpetual Existence. Fragments of your various lives linger within you. You ignore all class, species and spellcasting requirements on attuning to or using a magic item.

Stillness in Sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

Revenance. As your nature blurs the lines of life and undeath, spells that preserve life that do not normally affect undead, work on you

Furthermore, you are immune against any effect the turns undead.

advancement.title: INT Bonus
advancement.hint: Core rule that provides a bonus based on character level and intelligence modifier at levels 6, 12, 18.  Does NOT apply retroactively and is not affected by temporary changes in Intelligence stat (from items or other buffs/debuffs).
